Refrigerated trucks and vans:These are vehicles equipped with cooling systems to transport perishable goods such as burger patties at controlled temperatures to maintain their freshness and quality during transit.
Budget constraint:This refers to the limitation on the total amount of money that can be spent on shipping the burger patties. In this case, the meat shop has a budget of $12500 for the shipment.
Trip optimization:This involves planning the shipment of burger patties in such a way that the total number of trips taken by the refrigerated trucks and vans is minimized while meeting the minimum requirement of shipping at least 50000 patties.
